answers.text:
Barbara – I only found one city that posted statistical data; I hope its’ helpful:
Auburn, AL – HR statistical data
http://www.auburnalabama.org/hr/Default.aspx?PageID=72 
Pam

answers.author: Rosalee Wood
answers.text:
I am currently conducting a very small query of several Southern California sites... I'm happy to share, although I don't know if what I gather will be of much assistance to you - we are not looking historically, but rather just over the last 12 months.

answers.author: Barbara DeLeon
answers.text:
Rosalee, I would certainly be interested in seeing any information you are able to collect.  According to the Bureau of Labor and Statistics, the average U.S. job vacancy rate (# job openings/total # jobs) has averaged 3% over the past year, while the latest report shows the state/local government rate at under 2% over the past year.  By these measures our 10% rate seems high.  I look forward to seeing your data.

author: Barbara DeLeon
text: In our city, we typically have a 10% full-time staff vacancy rate at any given time, and we are curious about other municipalities' vacancy rates.  If you can share it would be most appreciated!
title: Municipal Vacancy Rates
